Hello @dsaxton! Thanks for updating the PR.



Cheers ! There are no PEP8 issues in this Pull Request. :beers: 

##### Comment last updated on February 07, 2019 at 01:56 Hours UTC

> which seems to happen whenever the return value is named. Should these be errors?

Yea this is intentional. Unless multiple values are being returned should just have a type in the Returns section

@WillAyd Side question, but when I merge with master on GitHub, how do I prevent lots of unrelated files from being marked as edited in my PR when I pull locally and then later push?

Typically I would do the below locally on branch in question

```sh
git fetch upstream
git merge upstream/master
<FIX CONFLICTS IF ANY, then git merge --continue>
git push origin your-branch-name
```
@dsaxton seeing some movement on this and maybe other PRs. Please ping when you are ready for review
@WillAyd Would be happy to have you take a look whenever you get a chance

Thanks - latest version looks like a good improvement over what was there previously. Can you provide updated script validations? Probably OK to leave a few out there for follow up PRs just want to make sure we haven't increased number of errors before approving

Makes sense. I checked most remaining and most are errors with the validator itself (ex: things that start with bullet points in description). I think this is a good enough improvement to move forward so we don't get stuck in a holding pattern forever.

cc @datapythonista - looks like there might be a new error for the below line, where `'integer'` is a valid argument but the validator complains about it not being written out as `int`. I'll open up an issue for that separately
